post_text: As part of the high school's Basic Design class, students learn about architecture as an art career. Focusing on rhythm and repetition, studying the work of Frank Loyd Wright, Frank Gehry and Zaha Hadid -- students learn how architecture responds to the environment and nature. Their final assignment is to create a design for a building inspired by an object in nature using SketchUp. This semester, to provide more options due to distance learning, Paula Yff allowed her students to use Minecraft if they wanted and were able. Junior Sachi Yang, created this library inspired by a turtle. He was thinking a lot about the use of light and creating places for reflection. It is a stunning example of innovation in the time of the crisis!

post_text: Congratulations to Columbia Academy student Thanhtruc Mai for qualifying to compete in the National History Day Competition! Thanhtruc is an 8th grader at Columbia Academy who was part of a team of 13 CA students who qualified for the MN State History Day Competition. Thanhtruc created a website to present her research project titled: Oyama v. California: Confronting Alien Land Laws. Six other students made it to the final round of the State Tournament and received Honorable Mention for their work. Congratulations to Larisa Kadric for her exhibit on Alice Paula and the 19th Amendment: A Voice for Women; Adriana Inamagua and Mioftu Kurkura for their exhibit titled Breaking Down the Barrier for Love: Loving v. Virginia; Katelynn Hackett and Maddie Mueller for their exhibit titled Baker v. Nelson: The Fight for Love; and Bea Carter and Gen Johnson for their exhibit titled Website: Clipped Wings: The WASP's Fight to Flight. We wish Thanhtruc the best as she prepares for the virtual National Competition, normally held in Washington D.C., in July. Stay tuned for a mid-summer update!

Due to the incoming snow storm forecast on Friday, January 17, and possible blizzard conditions on Saturday, January 18, Columbia Heights Public Schools has the following announcement for families:
• All Columbia Heights Public Schools after school and evening activities and athletics are cancelled today, Friday, January 17.
• All Columbia Heights Public School activities and athletics are cancelled on Saturday, January 18.
• Elementary school students will be dismissed fifteen minutes early to give buses extra time to pick up secondary students.
• Columbia Academy and CHHS students will be dismissed at their regular dismissal time.
• Adventure Club and Mini Adventures will remain open, and we encourage our families to pick up their children as soon as they possibly can.
We wish our students and families safe travels and look forward to welcoming all our students back to school on Wednesday, January 22. CHPS is closed on Monday, January 20 for a District In-service Day and CHPS is closed on Tuesday, January 21 for a Grading Day.
